intro: Phoradendron bolleanum var. capitellatum, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a climbing plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical forests. Its unique floral display makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
